wikipedia_page.main: William Bullein (c.1515–1576) was an English physician and cleric.

response: **William Bullein – Bullein's Bulwarke of Defence againste all Sicknes, Sornes, and Woundes

Kranich is alluded to, both favourably and unfavourably, in published works by several Elizabethan and Jacobean authors. He is satirised under the anagram 'Dr Tocrub' in the 1573 and 1578 editions of William Bullein's A Dialogue Against the Fever Pestilence, although there is no Dr Tocrub in the original edition of 1564.

It isn't known what happened to Agnes Bowker but the picture of the cat is now in the British Library. Bowker's alleged birth of a cat was also dismissed by the London physician William Bullein in 1573.
